description.narrative: The aim of the development intervention is to contribute to the debate in society about human development. Through analysis and studies of the development interventions undertaken in Guatemala and the results thereof, UNDP aims at identifying critical aspects and structural barriers that have hampered development, as well as identifying medium and long-term measures. This information will be used for strategic proposals for an improved development model at local and national level.

Insatsen bidrar med finansiering till UNDPs arbete med att generera kunskap och stimulera debatt kring utvecklingspolitiken i Guatemala, i syfte att ta fram medel- och långsiktiga förslag på reformer som landet behöver genomföra för att kunna uppnå de hållbara utvecklingsmålen i Agenda 2030.
Sida kommer att bidra med totalt 5 miljoner kronor för åren 2018–2020 så att UNDP kan producera en omfattande rapport om mänsklig utveckling i Guatemala och stimulera ett brett deltagande i utformningen av rapporten, särskilt bland kvinnor, ungdomar och urfolk. Sidas finansiering kommer att gå till löner för de personer som genomför projektet för UNDPs räkning, konsultuppdrag för bakgrundsstudier och kommunikationsinsatser.
Processen med att ta fram rapporten kommer att sammanfalla med valrörelsen i Guatemala. Möjligheten att bistå med informativa verktyg för att inkludera fler medborgare i det politiska samtalet kommer att tas tillvara genom projektet, till exempel genom workshops och kommunikationsinsatser på lokal nivå.
Rapporten kommer också att utgöra underlag till framtagandet av FNs nya biståndsramverk för Guatemala (United Nations Development Assistance Framework), något som Sverige har särskilt intresse av då en betydande del av det svenska utvecklingssamarbetet med Guatemala genomförs av FN-organisationer.
Sida kommer att driva följande frågor under projektimplementeringen: (i) vikten av ett tydligt jämställdhetsperspektiv på mänsklig utveckling; (ii) samordning FN-organisationerna emellan i syfte att skapa en gemensam analytisk grund inför utformningen av det nya biståndsramverket; och (iii) tillämpning av ansatser från Sidas egen modell för multidimensionell fattigdomsanalys.

The development intervention provides funding for UNDP's work to generate knowledge and stimulate debate on development policy in Guatemala, in order to develop medium and long-term reform proposals that the country needs to implement in order to achieve the sustainable development goals in Agenda 2030.
Sida will contribute with a total of SEK 5 million for the years 2018-2020 so that UNDP can produce a comprehensive human development report in Guatemala and stimulate broad participation in the design of the report, especially among women, young people and indigenous peoples. Sida's funding will go to salaries for those who implement the UNDP project, consultancy assignments for background studies and communication activities.
The process of producing the report will coincide with the electoral movement in Guatemala. The opportunity to assist with informative tools to include more citizens in the political debate will be utilized through the project, for example through workshops and communication initiatives at the local level.
The report will also provide the basis for the development of the new United Nations Assistance Framework for Guatemala, something that Sweden is particularly interested in when a significant part of Swedish development cooperation with Guatemala is being conducted by UN organizations.
Sida will pursue the following issues during project implementation: (i) the importance of a clear gender equality perspective on human development; (ii) coordination between the UN organizations in order to create a common analytical basis for the design of the new Assistance Framework; and (iii) application of Sida's own model for multidimensional poverty analysis.

tag.narrative: 10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
The two main areas of the project are 1) production of the Human Development Report for Guatemala, which will include an analysis and proposal of a new development model, as well as update the indicators on municipal level, and 2) to communicate a new development model at national and territorial level. A third new objective has been added by the UNDP for the work undertaken in 2021: include an analysis of impacts on the human development due to the Cvid-19 pandemic in Guatemala.
The human development report was originally planned to be published when the new government took office in January 2020. It was expected that the new government would use the report as a reliable information source out of which development politics would be designed in order to reduce poverty and increase equality. The report has been extended to end of august 2021. It is likely that the report is to be delayed further, and to be published first in early 2022, due to contextual issues and the pandemic.
The results from 2020 relates mostly to having achieved analysis and compilation of the information obtained in the field work carried out in 2019, which was reported somewhat restricted due to the Covid-19 pandemic and following lock down in Guatemala. Other results in the first objective of the program include discussions, seminars, workshops with relevant stakeholders on the information gathered.
In the second objective of the contribution, relating to communication on various levels to increase outreach and knowledge of the poverty situation in Guatemala, UNDP reports on conferences and presentations on human development undertaken in 2020. The design of first communication phase of the human development report was also completed. A new frame of the communication strategy has also been presented - "promoting a constructive dialogue, based on the results of the report, in order to prioritize strategic routes for development in conversation with key territorial actors".
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
